paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant L51P, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: experienced syncope and diagnosed with long QT syndrome
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient experienced syncope and was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 28.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with long QT syndrome after cardiac event
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was diagnosed with long QT syndrome after a cardiac event at age 21.
The individual is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with long QT syndrome after family screening
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 38 after family screening.

functional_data.summary: L51P mutation impairs channel activation and reduces functionality.

variants.segregation_data: The L51P variant segregates with long QT syndrome in affected families.
variants.additional_notes: The study provides insights into the functional impact of the L51P mutation on the KCNH2 gene.
key_quotes: L51P caused loss of function via impairing channel activation.
L51P was predicted to destroy hydrophobic structure in the PAS domain.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of KCNH2 variants and associated clinical data.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant L51P was successfully extracted.
